Name: Hydrogen
Uses of Element: 90% of atoms in the universe, sun and stars,H2O, life's organic molecules

Name: Helium
Uses of Element: fuel for nuclear fusion in sun and stars, balloons,lasers, supercold refrigerant

Name: Lithium
Uses of Element: lightweight aluminum alloys,batteries, impact-resistant ceramic cookware (Corningware ), mood stabilizer

Name: Beryllium
Uses of Element: non-sparking copper alloy tools, aerospace, X-ray windows, beryl gems: emeralds and aquamarines

Name: Boron
Uses of Element: borax soap, fertilizer, stiff fibers, sports equipment (golf clubs, tennis rackets, skis), heat-resistant borosilicate glass (Pyrex ),semiconductors

Name: Carbon
Uses of Element: basis of life's organic molecules, animals, plants,CO2, wood, paper,°Cloth,plastic,°Coal, oil

Name: Nitrogen
Uses of Element: 78% of air, organic molecules, protein, muscles,DNA, ammonia, fertilizer,explosives (TNT),refrigerants

Name: Oxygen
Uses of Element: 21% of air, H2O, 65% of the human body, organic molecules, blood, breathing,fire, half of earth's crust,minerals, oxides

Name: Fluorine
Description: yellowish poison gas, most reactive element
Uses of Element: glowing fluorite,toothpaste, nonstick cookware (Teflon ),°CFC refrigerants (Freon )

Name: Neon
Uses of Element: orange-red neon tubes for advertising signs, lasers,supercold refrigerant

Name: Sodium
Uses of Element: salt (NaCl), nerves, baking soda, antacids, lye, soap,soda ash, glass,papermaking, street lamps

Name: Magnesium
Uses of Element: chlorophyll in green plants,talc, basalt, aluminum alloys,°Cars, planes, bikes,flares, sparklers, antacids

Name: Aluminium
Uses of Element: common metal, kitcheware,cans, foil, machinery,°Cars,planes, bikes, feldspar,granite,°Clay,°Ceramics,corundum, gems

Name: Silicon
Uses of Element: quartz, granite, sand, soil,clay,°Ceramics, glass, algae,diatoms, semiconductors,computer chips, silicone rubber

Name: Phosphorus
Description: glowing white waxy solid (also red and black forms)
Uses of Element: bones, DNA, energy-storing phosphates (ATP),fertilizer, acids,detergents, matches

Name: Sulphur
Uses of Element: skin, hair, egg yolks, onions,garlic, skunks, hot springs,volcanos, gypsum, rubber,acids, papermaking

Name: Chlorine
Uses of Element: salt (NaCl), bleach, stomach acid, disinfectant, drinking water, swimming pools, PVC plastic pipes and bottles

Name: Argon
Uses of Element: 1% of air, most abundant inert gas on earth, light bulbs, "neon" tubes, lasers,welding gas

Name: Potassium
Uses of Element: salts, nerves, nutrient in fruits and vegetables, soap,fertilizer, potash, matches,gunpowder

Name: Calcium
Uses of Element: bones, teeth, milk, leaves,vegetables, shells,°Coral,limestone,°Chalk, gypsum,plaster, mortar,°Cement,marble, antacids

Name: Scandium
Uses of Element: aluminum alloys, racing bikes, stadium lamps,furnace bricks, aquamarines

Name: Titanium
Uses of Element: aerospace, racing bikes,artificial joints, white paint, blue sapphires

Name: Vanadium
Uses of Element: hard strong resilient steel,structures, vehicles,springs, driveshafts, tools,aerospace, violet sapphires

Name: Chromium
Uses of Element: stainless steel (Fe-Cr-Ni),kitchenware, nichrome heaters,°Car trim, paints,recording tape, emeralds and rubies

Name: Manganese
Uses of Element: hard tough steel,earthmovers, rock crushers, rails, plows, axes,batteries, fertilizer,amethysts

Name: Iron
Uses of Element: steel alloys are mostly iron,structures, vehicles,magnets, earth's core, red rocks, blood

Name: Cobalt
Uses of Element: hard strong steel,°Cutting tools, turbines, magnets (Al-Ni-Co), blue glass and ceramics, vitamin B-12

Name: Nickel
Uses of Element: stainless steel (Fe-Cr-Ni),kitchenware, nichrome heaters,°Coins, nicad batteries, earth's core

Name: Copper
Description: colored metal, conducts heat and electricity well
Uses of Element: wires,°Cookware, brass (Cu-Zn), bronze (Cu-Sn),°Coins,pipes, blue crab blood

Name: Zinc
Uses of Element: galvanized steel, brass (Cu-Zn), batteries, white paint,phosphors in TVs and lamps,fertilizer

Name: Gallium
Description: soft metal, melts on a hot day
Uses of Element: semiconductors, light-emitting diodes (LEDs) (GaAs), signal lights, tiny lasers

Name: Germanium
Uses of Element: semiconductors,transistors, rectifiers,diodes, photocells, lenses,infrared windows

Name: Arsenic
Uses of Element: poisons, semiconductors,light-emitting diodes (LEDs) (GaAs), signal lights,tiny lasers

Name: Selenium
Uses of Element: semiconductors,photocopiers, laser printers, photocells, red glass, dandruff shampoo,rubber

Name: Bromine
Uses of Element: disinfectant, pools and spas, photo film, flame retardant, leaded gas,sedatives

Name: Krypton
Uses of Element: high-intensity lamps,headlights, flashlights,lanterns, "neon" tubes,lasers

Name: Rubidium
Uses of Element: atomic clocks, global navigation (GPS), vacuum tube scavenger

Name: Strontium
Uses of Element: red fireworks, flares,phosphors, nuclear batteries, medical diagnostic tracer, nuclear fallout

Name: Yttrium
Uses of Element: phosphors in color TVs,lasers (YAG, YLF), furnace bricks, high-temperature superconductors

Name: Zirconium
Uses of Element: chemical pipelines, nuclear reactors, furnace bricks,abrasives, zircon gems

Name: Niobium
Uses of Element: chemical pipelines,superconductors, magnetic levitation trains, MRI magnets

Name: Molybdenum
Uses of Element: hard steel,°Cutting tools,drill bits, armor plate, gun barrels, fertilizer

Name: Technetium
Uses of Element: first human-made element,only traces on earth but found in stars, medical diagnostic tracer

Name: Ruthenium
Uses of Element: electric contacts, leaf switches, pen tips,°Catalyst,hydrogen production

Name: Rhodium
Uses of Element: labware, reflectors,electric contacts,thermocouples,°Catalyst,pollution control

Name: Palladium
Uses of Element: labware, electric contacts,dentistry,°Catalyst,pollution control

Name: Silver
Description: soft shiny metal, conducts electricity best of all elements
Uses of Element: jewelry, silverware,°Coins,dentistry, photo film

Name: Cadmium
Uses of Element: electroplated steel, nicad batteries, red and yellow paints, fire sprinklers

Name: Indium
Uses of Element: solders, glass seals, glass coatings, liquid crystal displays (LCD),semiconductors, diodes,photocells

Name: Tin
Uses of Element: solders, plated food cans,bronze (Cu-Sn), pewter cups, glassmaking, fire sprinklers

Name: Antimony
Uses of Element: solders, lead hardener,batteries, bullet,semiconductors, photocells,matches, flame retardant

Name: Tellurium
Uses of Element: alloys, semiconductors,photocopiers,°Computer disk, thermo-electric coolers and generators

Name: Iodine
Uses of Element: disinfectant for wounds and drinking water, added to salt to prevent thyroid disease, photo film

Name: Xenon
Uses of Element: high-intensity lamps,headlights, stadium lamps,projectors, strobes, lasers,spacecraft ion engines

Name: Caesium
Description: soft metal, melts on a hot day, reactive, largest stable atoms
Uses of Element: atomic clocks, global navigation (GPS), vacuum tube scavenger

Name: Barium
Uses of Element: stomach X-ray contrast enhancer, green fireworks,whitener and filler for paper

Name: Lanthanum
Uses of Element: optical glass, telescope eyepieces,°Camera lenses,lighter flints, arc lamps

Name: Cerium
Uses of Element: most abundant rare earth metal, lighter flints, arc lamps, gas lamp mantles,self-cleaning ovens, glass polishing

Name: Praseodymium
Uses of Element: torchworkers' didymium eyeglasses, lighter flints,arc lamps, magnets, yellow glass

Name: Neodymium
Uses of Element: strong magnets (Nd-Fe-B),electric motors, speakers and headphones, lasers,lighter flints

Name: Promethium
Uses of Element: human-made, small traces in nature, luminous dials,sheet thickness gauges

Name: Samarium
Uses of Element: magnets (Sm-Co), electric motors, speakers and headphones, infrared sensors, infrared-absorbing glass

Name: Europium
Uses of Element: phosphors in color TVs and trichromatic fluorescent lamps, luminous paint, lasers

Name: Gadolinium
Description: soft metal, best neutron absorber, magnetic
Uses of Element: magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) contrast enhancer,phosphors, neutron radiography

Name: Terbium
Uses of Element: phosphors in color TVs and trichromatic fluorescent lamps,°Computer disks,magnetostrictive "smart" materials (Fe-Dy-Tb) (Terfenol-D )

Name: Dysprosium
Uses of Element: nuclear control rods, MRI phosphors,°Computer disks,magnetostrictive "smart" materials (Fe-Dy-Tb) (Terfenol-D )

Name: Holmium
Uses of Element: infrared lasers, laser surgery, eye-safe laser rangefinders,°Computer disks, yellow glass filters

Name: Erbium
Uses of Element: fiber optic signal amplifiers, infrared lasers,laser surgery, pink glass,sunglasses, vanadium alloys

Name: Thulium
Uses of Element: rarest stable rare earth metal, infrared lasers, laser surgery, phosphors

Name: Ytterbium
Uses of Element: fiber optic signal amplifiers, infrared fiber lasers, stainless steel alloys

Name: Lutetium
Description: soft metal, densest and hardest rare earth metal
Uses of Element: cancer-fighting photodynamic (light-activated) medicine

Name: Hafnium
Uses of Element: nuclear reactor control rods in submarines, plasma torch electrodes

Name: Tantalum
Uses of Element: labware, surgical tools,artificial joints,°Capacitors,mobile phones

Name: Tungsten

Name: Rhenium
Uses of Element: rocket engines, heater coils, laboratory filaments,electric contacts,thermocouples,°Catalyst

Name: Osmium
Description: non-corroding high-melting-point hard metal, densest element (same as Ir)
Uses of Element: electric contacts, pen tips,needles, fingerprint powder

Name: Iridium

Uses of Element: labware, spark plugs, pen tips, needles

Name: Gold
